data.chText: 路；道路；公路
data.enText: a hard surface built for vehicles to travel on

data.chText: 公路干线；大 / 支路
data.enText: a main/major/minor road

data.chText: 乡村道路；山路
data.enText: a country/mountain road

data.chText: 他们就住在这条路前面不远的地方。
data.enText: They live just along/up/down the road (= further on the same road) .

data.chText: 房子位于一条交通非常繁忙的公路旁边。
data.enText: The house is on a very busy road.

data.chText: 他正在路边散步，突然遭到袭击。
data.enText: He was walking along the road when he was attacked.

data.chText: 开车大约要花五个小时。
data.enText: It takes about five hours by road (= driving) .

data.chText: 用铁路运送这批货物会比用公路好。
data.enText: It would be better to transport the goods by rail rather than by road .

data.chText: 走左边的第一条路，然后循着路标走。
data.enText: Take the first road on the left and then follow the signs.

data.chText: 我们把车停放在叉道上。
data.enText: We parked on a side road .

data.chText: 公路交通事故 / 安全；道路使用者
data.enText: road accidents/safety/users

data.chText: （用于道路名称，尤指城镇的）路
data.enText: used in names of roads, especially in towns

data.chText: 约克路35号
data.enText: 35 York Road

data.chText: 途径；方法；路子
data.enText: the way to achieving sth

data.chText: 正在恢复之中
data.enText: to be on the road to recovery

data.chText: 我们已经讨论了私有化问题，但不想采用这种方法。
data.enText: We have discussed privatization, but we would prefer not to go down that particular road .
any road
(further) along/down the road

data.chText: 今后；在将来
data.enText: at some time in the future

data.chText: 往后肯定会有更多人失业。
data.enText: There are certain to be more job losses further down the road.
one for the road

data.chText: 告辞前喝的最后一杯酒
data.enText: a last alcoholic drink before you leave a party, etc.
on the road

data.chText: 在途中；（尤指）长途旅行中
data.enText: travelling, especially for long distances or periods of time

data.chText: 那支乐队巡回演出已有六个月了。
data.enText: The band has been on the road for six months.

data.chText: （状况良好）可行驶
data.enText: in good condition so that it can be legally driven

data.chText: 要花大约500英镑才能让车子重新上路。
data.enText: It will cost about £500 to get the car back on the road.

data.chText: 居无定所；漂泊
data.enText: moving from place to place, and having no permanent home

data.chText: 流浪生活会非常艰辛。
data.enText: Life on the road can be very hard.
the road to hell is paved with good intentions

data.chText: 黄泉路上徒有好意多；光说不练是不够的
data.enText: it is not enough to intend to do good things; you must actually do them
hit the road/trail

data.chText: 出发；上路
data.enText: to start a journey/trip
get the show on the road

data.chText: 开始；出发
data.enText: to start an activity or a journey

data.chText: 咱们这就开始吧！
data.enText: Let's get this show on the road!

data.chText: 公路和街道
data.enText: Roads and streets

data.chText: 在城镇，street为最普通的用语，指街道：
data.enText: In a town or city, street is the most general word for a road with houses and buildings on one or both sides.

data.chText: 伦敦街道图
data.enText: a street map of London

data.chText: street不用以指城镇间的道路，而城镇里的街道常称作road：
data.enText: Street is not used for roads between towns, but streets in towns are often called Road .

data.chText: 牛津街
data.enText: Oxford Street

data.chText: 迈尔恩德路
data.enText: Mile End Road

data.chText: 法国公路交通图（road map）标有连接、环绕和穿越各城镇的主要路线。
data.enText: A road map of France would show you the major routes between, around and through towns and cities.

data.chText: 其他可用于街道名称的词有Circle、Court、Crescent、Drive、Hill和Way。avenue指宽阔的林荫道，lane指建筑物间的小巷、胡同，或在英国英语中指乡村小路。
data.enText: Other words used in the names of streets include: Circle , Court , Crescent , Drive , Hill and Way . Avenue suggests a wide street lined with trees. A lane is a narrow street between buildings or, in BrE , a narrow country road.

data.chText: 市镇商业大街
data.enText: The high street

data.chText: high street用于英国英语，尤作商店、银行等集中的市镇商业大街名：
data.enText: High street is used in BrE , especially as a name, for the main street of a town, where most shops, banks, etc. are.

data.chText: 商业大街的唱片商店
data.enText: the record store in the High Street

data.chText: 市镇大街的商店
data.enText: high street shops

data.chText: 在北美英语中，此义常用Main Street表示。
data.enText: In NAmE Main Street is often used as a name for this street.

data.chText: 较宽大的公路
data.enText: Larger roads

data.chText: 表示连接城镇的公路时，英国英语和美国英语的用词各异。motorway用于英国英语（如57高速路），freeway、highway或interstate用于北美英语（如347州道、94州际公路、长岛高速公路），它们均指城外分道行驶的长途高速公路。
data.enText: British and American English use different words for the roads that connect towns and cities. Motorways , (for example, the M57) in BrE , freeways , highways or interstates , (for example State Route 347, Interstate 94, the Long Island Expressway) in NAmE , are large divided roads built for long-distance traffic to avoid towns.

data.chText: ring road（英国英语）/ outer belt（北美英语）指为减少市中心的交通流量修建的环城公路。在北美英语中亦可叫做beltway，不过该词通常指华盛顿市的环城公路。bypass指不穿越市中心，绕过城市的旁道。
data.enText: A ring road ( BrE ) / an outer belt ( NAmE ) is built around a city or town to reduce traffic in the centre. This can also be called a beltway in NAmE , especially when it refers to the road around Washington D.C. A bypass passes around a town or city rather than through the centre.

means: (用于道路名称，尤指城镇的)路

ex.chText: 公路
ex.enText: highway

ex.chText: 高速公路
ex.enText: motorway

ex.chText: 铁路
ex.enText: railway

ex.chText: 他问路人去邮局的路。
ex.enText: He asked a passer-by the way to the post office.

ex.chText: 有一辆卡车挡住了路。
ex.enText: There was a truck blocking the way.

ex.chText: 这是通往那个小村庄的道路。
ex.enText: This is the way to the small village.

synonyms.bx: 普通用词，含义广泛，可指任何形式的路，也常和其他词构成复合词。

ex.chText: 我的地址是：美国纽约第5大街211号。
ex.enText: My address is 211, Ave. 5, New York, USA.

ex.chText: 人们喜欢沿巴黎的大街散步。
ex.enText: People love to walk down the avenues of Paris.

ex.chText: 她喜欢沿着林阴道散步。
ex.enText: She likes to walk along the avenue.

synonyms.bx: 指城镇中长而宽的大街，通常为南北走向；英国英语中则指通向大房子的林阴道。

ex.chText: 车道两边是两行大树。
ex.enText: There are two lines of big trees on both sides of the drive.

ex.chText: 他把送货车停在小别墅的私人车道上。
ex.enText: He pulled up the delivery van at the cottage drive.

ex.chText: 我们不能把车停在这条私人车道上。
ex.enText: We can't park the car on this drive.

synonyms.bx: 指连接私人住宅与外部街道的车道，通常专供私人车辆通行。

ex.chText: 离开那个镇子的公路有两条。
ex.enText: There are two highways out of the town.

ex.chText: 这条公路与那条铁路平行。
ex.enText: The highway runs parallel with the railway.

synonyms.bx: 指连接两个城镇的主干道。

ex.chText: 由于大雾，高速公路关闭了。
ex.enText: The motorway has been closed due to the thick fog.

ex.chText: 沿着高速公路可以看到很多警示牌。
ex.enText: You can see many warning signs along the motorway.

synonyms.bx: 尤指城市之间的高速公路。

ex.chText: 你注意到草地上那条被踩得坑坑洼洼的小径了吗？
ex.enText: Have you noticed the well-worn path across the grass?

ex.chText: 他们顺着小路来到那个村子。
ex.enText: They followed the path to the village.

ex.chText: 我们沿着小路行走，欣赏着自然风光。
ex.enText: We walked along the path, enjoying the natural scenery.

ex.chText: 他们只得在丛林中开出一条小路。
ex.enText: They had to cut out a path through the jungle.

synonyms.bx: 通常指小道、小路、小径，特别是田间、林间常由人或牲畜走出来的小径。

ex.chText: 这条路是上周正式通车的。
ex.enText: This road was formally opened last week.

ex.chText: 过马路的时候再小心也不为过。
ex.enText: You cannot be too careful while crossing the road.

ex.chText: 在人行道上走要比在马路中间走安全。
ex.enText: It's safer to walk on the pavement than in the road.

ex.chText: 那个女人在结冰的路上滑了一跤，摔断了腿。
ex.enText: The woman slipped on the icy road and broke her leg.

synonyms.bx: 词义广泛，多指供车辆、行人或马匹等使用的平坦大道，也指旁边有建筑物的街道。

ex.chText: 我们已选定了要走的路线。
ex.enText: We've decided on the route to take.

ex.chText: 你进城最好走这条道。
ex.enText: You'd better take this route to town.

ex.chText: 这是去底特律最快的路线。
ex.enText: It's the quickest route to Detroit.

ex.chText: 专机没有按通常的商业航线飞行。
ex.enText: The special plane did not fly the usual commercial route.

synonyms.bx: 指从某处到另一处的路线，或公共汽车、火车、轮船、飞机等的固定路线或航线。

ex.chText: 你去过这条商业街吗？
ex.enText: Have you ever been to this shopping street?

ex.chText: 这里曾经是一条安静的居民街。
ex.enText: This used to be a quiet residential street.

synonyms.bx: 指城镇中的道路，其一侧或两侧通常有房屋、商店等建筑物。

one for the road

data.enText: a last alcoholic drink before you leave a party, etc.

data.enText: in good condition so that it can be legally driven

data.chText: 要花大约500英镑才能让车子重新上路。

data.chText: 居无定所；漂泊
data.enText: moving from place to place, and having no permanent home

data.chText: 流浪生活会非常艰辛。
data.enText: Life on the road can be very hard.
the road to hell is paved with good intentions

data.chText: 黄泉路上徒有好意多；光说不练是不够的
data.enText: it is not enough to intend to do good things; you must actually do them
(reach) the end of the line/road

data.chText: （达到）尽头，极限；穷途末路
data.enText: (to reach) the point at which sth can no longer continue in the same way

data.chText: 第二轮的失利表明去年的冠军得主已卫冕无望。
data.enText: A defeat in the second round marked the end of the line for last year's champion.
hit the road/trail

data.chText: 出发；上路
data.enText: to start a journey/trip
get the show on the road

data.chText: 开始；出发
data.enText: to start an activity or a journey

data.chText: 咱们这就开始吧！
data.enText: Let's get this show on the road!

tr: a way or means to achieve something
an open way (generally public) for travel or transportation

value.def: A road is a long piece of hard ground which is built between two places so that people can drive or ride easily from one place to the other.

example.ex: There was very little traffic on the roads...
We just go straight up the Bristol Road...
example.tran: 我们就沿着布里斯托尔大道直走。

example.ex: He was coming down the road the same time as the girl was turning into the lane...
example.tran: 当女孩拐进这个车道时，他也正沿着这条路驶来。

example.ex: Buses carry 30 per cent of those travelling by road...
example.tran: 公交车承载了公路交通客流量的30％。

value.def: The road to a particular result is the means of achieving it or the process of achieving it.

example.ex: We are bound to see some ups and downs along the road to recovery.
example.tran: 在经济复苏的过程中，我们一定会经历一些曲折起伏。

value.def: If you hit the road, you set out on a journey.

example.ex: I was relieved to get back in the car and hit the road again.
example.tran: 回到车里重新上路后，我松了一口气。

value.def: If you are on the road, you are going on a long journey or a series of journeys by road.

example.ex: He hoped to get a new truck and go back on the road.
example.tran: 他希望能有一辆新的卡车，重新上路。

value.def: If you say that someone is on the road to something, you mean that they are likely to achieve it.

example.ex: The government took another step on the road to political reform.
example.tran: 政府在实现政治改革的路上又迈进了一步。

example.ex: ...the stunning fashion pictures which launched unknown teenager Jane March on the road to stardom.
example.tran: 让名不见经传的少女简·马奇走向成名之路的惊艳的时装照片
